title: game freezes when I alt+tab
body:
It's been happening all day. Every time I alt-tab my computer completely freezes,nothing works,not even ctrl+alt+del. It happened 2-3 times in loading screen and 2 times in game(also got leave buster,but we won the match,why tf do you get lb if you win?!). After I restarted my PC and I got into the game,I pressed right click then my PC froze. I updated Windows 10 to Creator's Update this morning and my GPU driver too,so I don't know if one of them is causing this. Do you guys have any idea? I know uninstalling this game would be a great idea,but meh...
Earlier I've tested in CS GO and I could alt+tab but in League shit happens.

replies.body: I'm curious if updating to the Creator's version might be causing this.  Double check and make sure that the [Xbox Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) is disabled, as it's been known to cause freezing issues like this.  They have a tendency to auto-enable after an update, so let me know if that's the case.

Game bar is disabled,it was from the beginning. Even in practice tool,instant freeze when I alt+tab. The fact is that it happens now in CS GO too,but in Far Cry or Assassin's Creed it doesn't. I don't know what could cause this after that update,it's weird. Maybe something auto enabled after,I used to disable some windows funcitons to speed up my computer,as I did with superfecth,after the update it enabled automatically but I disabled it again.

Thanks for the details here, though that's pretty strange!  Hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can look into this with you.  Download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) as well to grab logs for more context, and attach it to your ticket.  

In the meantime, try out each step of the [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide as well to help rule out possibilities.  We'll get back to you!
Well,I "solved" the problem by going back to the previous version of Windows, Windows 10 Anniversary Update. So, there might be a problem with W10 Creators Update.
